abstract: Because of an editing error, an obituary on Wednesday about James S. McDonald, the chief executive of Rockefeller & Company, a wealth-management firm, referred incorrectly to Harvard College, suggesting it had changed its name since he graduated from it. Its name then was the same as it is now; he did not graduate “from what was the Harvard College.”.

lead_paragraph: Because of an editing error, an obituary on Wednesday about James S. McDonald, the chief executive of Rockefeller & Company, a wealth-management firm, referred incorrectly to Harvard College, suggesting it had changed its name since he graduated from it. Its name then was the same as it is now; he did not graduate “from what was the Harvard College.”
